description: Uploaded by https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/runbooks/-/jobs/7253336796 at Wed Jul  3 08:57:12 UTC 2024

panels.description: Apdex is a measure of requests that complete within a tolerable period of time for the service. Higher is better.

seriesOverrides.alias: /6h Degradation SLO \(5% of monthly error budget\).*/
/1h Outage SLO \(2% of monthly error budget\).*/

targets.legendFormat: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

panels.title: sentry Service Apdex

targets.expr:
sum(
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_1h{env="ops",environment="ops",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sentry"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_5m{env="ops",environment="ops",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sentry"} < on(tier, type, __tenant_id__) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="sentry"})))),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_1h{env="ops",environment="ops",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sentry"} < on(tier, type, __tenant_id__) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="sentry"})))),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_30m{env="ops",environment="ops",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sentry"} < on(tier, type, __tenant_id__) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="sentry"})))),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_6h{env="ops",environment="ops",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sentry"} < on(tier, type, __tenant_id__) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="sentry"})))),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.title: sentry Service Error Ratio

targets.expr:
sum(
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_1h{env="ops",environment="ops",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sentry"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on () (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{env="ops",environment="ops",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sentry"} > on(tier, type, __tenant_id__) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="sentry"})),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on () (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_1h{env="ops",environment="ops",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sentry"} > on(tier, type, __tenant_id__) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="sentry"})),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on () (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_30m{env="ops",environment="ops",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sentry"} > on(tier, type, __tenant_id__) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="sentry"})),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on () (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_6h{env="ops",environment="ops",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sentry"} > on(tier, type, __tenant_id__) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="sentry"})),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.title: pg_transactions SLI RPS - Requests per Second

panels.content:
### Description

Represents all SQL transactions issued to the sentry Postgres instance.
Errors represent transaction rollbacks.



### Observability Tools

* [Stackdriver Logs: Sentry](https://console.cloud.google.com/logs/query;query=labels%2E%22compute%2Egoogleapis%2Ecom%2Fresource%5Fname%22%3A%22sentry%22%0Aresource%2Etype%3D%22gce%5Finstance%22;timeRange=PT30M?project=gitlab-ops)
panels.title: Details

panels.title: sentry_events SLI Apdex

targets.expr:
sum(
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_1h{component="sentry_events",env="ops",environment="ops",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sentry"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_5m{component="sentry_events",env="ops",environment="ops",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sentry"} < on(tier, type, __tenant_id__) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="sentry_events",monitor="global",type="sentry"})))),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_1h{component="sentry_events",env="ops",environment="ops",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sentry"} < on(tier, type, __tenant_id__) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="sentry_events",monitor="global",type="sentry"})))),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_30m{component="sentry_events",env="ops",environment="ops",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sentry"} < on(tier, type, __tenant_id__) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="sentry_events",monitor="global",type="sentry"})))),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_6h{component="sentry_events",env="ops",environment="ops",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="sentry"} < on(tier, type, __tenant_id__) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="sentry_events",monitor="global",type="sentry"})))),

panels.title: sentry_events SLI RPS - Requests per Second

panels.content:
### Description

Sentry is an application monitoring platform.
 This SLI monitors the sentry API. 5xx responses are considered failures.
panels.title: Details

panels.description: The amount of non-idle time consumed by nodes for this service
panels.title: Node CPU

panels.description: Memory utilization. Lower is better.

panels.description: Disk Read IO operations per second. Lower is better.

panels.description: Loadavg (1 minute) per core, below 1 is better.

targets.expr:
avg by (environment, type, stage, fqdn) (node_load1{env="ops",environment="ops",stage="$stage",type="sentry"})
/
count by (environment, type, stage, fqdn) (node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", env="ops",environment="ops",stage="$stage",type="sentry"})

panels.title: loadavg1 per core

panels.description: Loadavg (5 minute) per core, below 1 is better.

targets.expr:
avg by (environment, type, stage, fqdn) (node_load5{env="ops",environment="ops",stage="$stage",type="sentry"})
/
count by (environment, type, stage, fqdn) (node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", env="ops",environment="ops",stage="$stage",type="sentry"})

panels.title: loadavg5 per core

panels.description: Loadavg (15 minute) per core, below 1 is better.

targets.expr:
avg by (environment, type, stage, fqdn) (node_load15{env="ops",environment="ops",stage="$stage",type="sentry"})
/
count by (environment, type, stage, fqdn) (node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", env="ops",environment="ops",stage="$stage",type="sentry"})

panels.title: loadavg15 per core

panels.description:
This resource measures average CPU utilization across an all cores in a service fleet.
If it is becoming saturated, it may indicate that the fleet needs
horizontal or vertical scaling.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      1 - avg by (environment, tier, type, stage, shard) (
        rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="sentry"}[5m])
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: cpu component saturation: Average Service CPU Utilization

panels.description:
Disk inode utilization per device per node.

If this is too high, its possible that a directory is filling up with
files. Consider logging in an checking temp directories for large numbers
of files
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard, fqdn, device) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      1 - (
        node_filesystem_files_free{fstype=~"(ext.|xfs)", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="sentry"}
        /
        node_filesystem_files{fstype=~"(ext.|xfs)", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="sentry"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: disk_inodes component saturation: Disk inode Utilization per Device per Node

panels.description:
Disk space utilization per device per node.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard, fqdn, device) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      (
        1 - node_filesystem_avail_bytes{fstype=~"ext.|xfs", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="sentry"} / node_filesystem_size_bytes{fstype=~"ext.|xfs", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="sentry"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: disk_space component saturation: Disk Space Utilization per Device per Node

panels.description:
Memory utilization per device per node.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard, fqdn) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      instance:node_memory_utilization:ratio{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="sentry"} or instance:node_memory_utilisation:ratio{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="sentry"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: memory component saturation: Memory Utilization per Node

panels.description:
Netfilter connection tracking table utilization per node.

When saturated, new connection attempts (incoming SYN packets) are dropped with no reply, leaving clients to slowly retry (and typically fail again) over the next several seconds.  When packets are being dropped due to this condition, kernel will log the event as: "nf_conntrack: table full, dropping packet".
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard, fqdn, instance) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      max_over_time(node_nf_conntrack_entries{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="sentry"}[1m])
      /
      node_nf_conntrack_entries_limit{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="sentry"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: nf_conntrack_entries component saturation: conntrack Entries per Node

panels.description:
Measures the amount of scheduler waiting time that processes are waiting
to be scheduled, according to [`CPU Scheduling Metrics`](https://www.robustperception.io/cpu-scheduling-metrics-from-the-node-exporter).

A high value indicates that a node has more processes to be run than CPU time available
to handle them, and may lead to degraded responsiveness and performance from the application.

Additionally, it may indicate that the fleet is under-provisioned.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard, fqdn, shard) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      avg without (cpu) (rate(node_schedstat_waiting_seconds_total{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="sentry"}[1h]))
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: node_schedstat_waiting component saturation: Node Scheduler Waiting Time

panels.description:
Open file descriptor utilization per instance.

Saturation on file descriptor limits may indicate a resource-descriptor leak in the application.

As a temporary fix, you may want to consider restarting the affected process.
 Lower is better.
panels.title: open_fds component saturation: Open file descriptor utilization per instance

panels.description:
Average CPU utilization across all cores on the Postgres primary instance.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(env, environment, tier, type, stage, shard, fqdn) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      avg without(cpu, mode) (
        1
        -
        (
          rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="sentry"}[5m])
          and on(fqdn)
          pg_replication_is_replica{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="sentry"} == 0
        )
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: pg_primary_cpu component saturation: Average CPU Utilization on Postgres Primary Instance

panels.description:
Risk of DB shutdown in the near future, approaching transaction ID wraparound.

This is a critical situation.

This saturation metric measures how close the database is to Transaction ID wraparound.

When wraparound occurs, the database will automatically shutdown to prevent data loss, causing a full outage.

Recovery would require entering single-user mode to run vacuum, taking the site down for a potentially multi-hour maintenance session.

To avoid reaching the db shutdown threshold, consider the following short-term actions:

1. Escalate to the SRE Datastores team, and then,

2. Find and terminate any very old transactions. The runbook for this alert has details.  Do this first.  It is the most critical step and may be all that is necessary to let autovacuum do its job.

3. Run a manual vacuum on tables with oldest relfrozenxid.  Manual vacuums run faster than autovacuum.

4. Add autovacuum workers or reduce autovacuum cost delay, if autovacuum is chronically unable to keep up with the transaction rate.

Long running transaction dashboard: https://dashboards.gitlab.net/d/alerts-long_running_transactions/alerts-long-running-transactions?orgId=1
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard, datname) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      (
        max without (series) (
          label_replace(pg_database_wraparound_age_datfrozenxid{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="sentry"}, "series", "datfrozenxid", "", "")
          or
          label_replace(pg_database_wraparound_age_datminmxid{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="sentry"}, "series", "datminmxid", "", "")
        )
        and on (instance, job) (pg_replication_is_replica{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="sentry"} == 0)
      )
      /
      (2^31 - 3000000)
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: pg_xid_wraparound component saturation: Transaction ID Wraparound

panels.description:
This resource measures average CPU utilization across an all cores in a shard of a
service fleet. If it is becoming saturated, it may indicate that the
shard needs horizontal or vertical scaling.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard, shard) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      1 - avg by (environment, tier, type, stage, shard, shard) (
        rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="sentry"}[5m])
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: shard_cpu component saturation: Average CPU Utilization per Shard

panels.description:
Average CPU utilization per Node.

If average CPU is saturated, it may indicate that a fleet is in need to horizontal or vertical scaling. It may also indicate
imbalances in load in a fleet.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard, fqdn) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      avg without(cpu, mode) (1 - rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="sentry"}[5m]))
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: single_node_cpu component saturation: Average CPU Utilization per Node
